unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify, describe and evaluate a few aspects of Greek-speaking cultures and societies.
Identify, evaluate and deploy the grammatical structures of Greek at elementary level.
Develop elementary level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Greek language.
Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.
Demonstrate an awareness of some language and language use in both Greek and English.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary, and Greek language practice. Students should be familiar with each week’s content before starting a new week. Class preparation time also includes time to study, revise seminar content and prepare for the quizzes and tests.

enrolment_rules.description: Not to count for credit for students who completed HSC Modern Greek beginners Band 4 and above, HSC Modern Greek Extension, HSC Modern Greek Continuers

assessments.description: Two online quizzes on grammar and language aspects. These will be held as a part of regular seminar time for both cohorts.
This is the final online test including grammar, reading and writing exercises, covering the content of Weeks 1-12. This will be held as a part of regular seminar time for both cohorts.
The grammar test is an online test held as a part of regular seminar time for both cohorts.
Weekly activities to check and confirm active engagement with course material. This will occur as part of regular scheduled seminar time for both cohorts.
Students are required to prepare a given scenario and act out specific roles appropriately. This will be held as a part of regular seminar time for both cohorts.

data.description: This unit is designed for beginners or near beginners of Modern Greek language. Its main aim is the acquisition of elementary reading, writing, comprehension and speaking skills in Modern Greek so that students may confidently communicate and correctly construct simple sentences in Greek. Vocabulary and grammar are taught through a communicative method. Students are also exposed to important aspects of Greek culture. This unit corresponds to the first level (A1) in the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR).
